means: 使浸入( immerse的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: She became immersed in planning her nuptials.
sentence.Network_cn: 她一门心思筹备自己的婚礼。

sentence.Network_en: The electrodes are immersed in liquid.
He's really becoming immersed in his work.
sentence.Network_cn: 他真的开始专心埋头于工作。

entry.tran: 使沉浸(于);使专心(于);使深陷(于)
entry.def: If you immerse yourself in something that you are doing, you become completely involved in it.

example.ex: Since then I've lived alone and immersed myself in my career.
example.tran: 自那以后,我一直一个人生活,全身心投入我的事业当中。

entry.def: If something is immersed in a liquid, someone puts it into the liquid so that it is completely covered.

example.ex: The electrodes are immersed in liquid.

auth_sentence.content: Within minutes, they will be immersed in Pandaria.
auth_sentence.res_content: Within minutes, they will be immersed in Pandaria.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Within minutes, they will be immersed in Pandaria.

auth_sentence.content: Ms. Dixon immersed herself in almost daily restaurant planning.
auth_sentence.res_content: Ms. Dixon immersed herself in almost daily restaurant planning.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ms. Dixon immersed herself in almost daily restaurant planning.

auth_sentence.content: But we also immersed ourselves in local activities and culture.
auth_sentence.res_content: But we also immersed ourselves in local activities and culture.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But we also immersed ourselves in local activities and culture.
